titles.title: Context-dependent effects of Y chromosome and mitochondrial haplotype on male locomotive activity in Drosophila melanogaster

descriptions.description: ID: Identifies Mito_Y_Dup_Diet where C=yeast and S=agar. Sample and Run: ID is split up into Sample and Run. Plate: Two different plates were used in the experiment. Hour: Broadly defines the time the assay was run. MinsAftLight: More specifically defines the time the assay was run. SocialEnviro: Describes the two different social contexts the assays were run under. Block: Describes the different sets of grandparental flies which the focal males descended from. ParentalAge: Describes the age of the parents when laying the eggs that grew into the focal males. Distmm: Distance travelled by flies in the 30 mins assay, in mm. emptyTime: Time when the software did not track the movement of the flies (checking the video images manually suggested this was because the flies were stationary). Mt = Mitochondrial haplotype, D = Dahomey, M = Madang. Y = Y chromosome genotype. Dup: The lines were maintained as two duplicates of each Mt and Y substitution. Diet: Focal males were assigned to one of two diets after emergence as adults - standard yeast diet (nutrient-rich) and a diet of just agar with no added nutrients (nutrient-deprived). Block.ParentalAge: Parental age nested within block. MtYDup: Identifies the MitoYDuplicate combination.
